text:
Situation A. Another Ice Cream Container

Stanley suggests making a new ice cream container. It is a rectangular box with a square base with side length 4 centimeter and a height of 8 centimeters. Will one scoop of ice cream fill the box? Explain.
No. The volume of rectangular box = (4 x 4) x 8 = 128 cm3. Since one scoop has volume of about 268 cm3, the rectangular box cannot hold one scoop of ice cream.

Situation B. Popcorn Containers

Fernando collected popcorn containers from several local movie theaters and recorded the prices and dimensions of the containers. The cost of the cone and rectangular box each cost $10. The cylinder container costs $12. Which is the best buy? Explain why.

The rectangular box is the best.

The amount of popcorn depends on the volume of its container.

  • The volume of the cone: (π × 10 × 10) × 30 × 1/3 ≈ 3140 cm3
  • The volume of the cylinder: (π × 8 × 8) × 20 ≈ 4019 cm3
  • The volume of the rectangular box: (12 × 15) × 20 = 3600 cm3

Then you can find the amount of popcorn per $1 to compare.

  • Cone: 3140/10 = 314 cm3 for 1 dollar.
  • Cylinder: 4019/12 ≈ 335 cm3 for 1 dollar.
  • Rectangular box: 3600/10 = 360 cm3 for 1 dollar.

Therefore, you can get the most popcorn in a rectangular box for 1 dollar.
